We have taken our time to examine the most popular and favourable NZ football tournaments globally for you in New Zealand. Dive in to unearth these lovely potential bounties.

FIFA World Cup

Quick Titbits: This global football tournament was established in 1930 and is played by 32 national teams from all over the world. The current holder of the trophy is France.

When it comes down to putting your stakes on this competition, the most popular bets are for the outright winner and the top scorer, even though it is always a daunting task to predict which team will win the competition and which player will be the highest goal scorer.

On the bright side, every time this competition Is to be played, there are always a set of teams peeled to win the trophy (the favourites). However, the underdogs might just pull a shocker stunt on us all. That always happens (check out Croatia getting to the final in the just-concluded edition in Russia)

Similarly, judging by the form of certain top players during the qualifying stage, you can pick out the favourites for the top scorer award as well, when you want to stake on the top scorer for the competition. The next edition is in 2022. Get set!

UEFA Euro Championship

Quick Titbits: This football tournament set in Europe was established in 1958 and is played by 24 European teams after a keenly contested qualifying stage by 55 teams. The current holder of the trophy is Portugal.

As concerning the kind of bets that are favourable to put your money on in this competition, betting on the outright winner is simply a matter of rooting for your preferred team. However, bets like the number of corners, the number of goals per game are just the best.

The outright winner can change easily as the competition itself is not easy. But with a good calculation, you can bag your wins from the number of corners or total number of goals per game

The UEFA Champions League

Quick Titbits: This is a  club football competition set in Europe. This competition was established in 1955 and is played by 32 European football clubs. The current holder of the trophy is Liverpool Football Club from England. The UEFA Champions League is the best club event held annually and it parades an array of the world’s best footballers.

When the question of which kind of bets will be best for you to put your stakes on in this competition, placing bets on which football club will be the outright winner is not the most advisable option. However, the great stars paraded in this competition allows you to place bets on markets like handicap betting, over or under goals bets, and other related bets.

UEFA Super Cup

Quick Titbits: This is another club football competition in Europe. This competition was established in 1972 and is played by 2 European football Champions(the winner of the UEFA Champions League and the winner of the UEFA Europa League). The current holders of the trophy are likewise Liverpool Football Club from England.

This is not a tournament as it is played as a single game with two teams. Yet, this single game can get volatile even though most of the recent ones have ended in a draw. Hence, you can stake bets on who will be the winner of the match including the extra time, should the two teams play out a draw. You can as well try out the Asian handicap market.
